NATIONAL NEWS






Duke seeking easier nukes: Rogers wants smoother regulatory path for plant approvals



May 9--As his company reported reduced first-quarter earnings, Duke Energy Chief Executive Jim Rogers said Tuesday smoothing the way for nuclear plant construction is a major challenge for Duke to boost future profits.  The importance of nuclear energy is a familiar message from the Charlotte CEO, who wants an easier regulatory road for building twin reactors in Cherokee County, S.C., by 2016. ...


May 9, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Toledo Edison parent to seek 2009 fee hike: Separate surcharge to end; customers would save $9.46 a month



May 9--The parent firm of Toledo Edison plans to raise its charge to distribute power in 2009, but said that an average customer bill should drop because of the end of a separate surcharge it has leveled for three years.  Overall, the changes needing approval of state regulators mean a Toledo Edison customer using 750 kilowatts a month would have a $9.46 drop in his monthly bill.


May 9, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Ohio Edison bills might go down: FirstEnergy proposes to end one rate, raise another; result is lower payments



May 9--Akron-based FirstEnergy Corp. on Tuesday notified the Public Utilities Commission of Ohio that it will request an increase in its distribution rates, effective Jan. 1, 2009, for Ohio Edison.  However, customers will see a net decrease in their bills because at the same time the proposed rate increase would take effect, another portion of their bill -- the "transition costs" -- would be ...


May 9, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Wind turbine plan approved: Wisconsin Power and Light to operate Fond du Lac County farm



May 10--Wisconsin regulators on Wednesday approved construction of 41 wind turbines in Fond du Lac County that will provide power for up to 30,000 customers of Madison-based Wisconsin Power and Light Co.  The $180 million project is expected to go into operation at the end of 2008. Cedar Ridge wind farm will be located on a 12.2-square-mile area in the towns of Eden and Empire -- an area known ...


May 10, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



TXU records loss of $497 million: All is not lost as cold winter saw rise in retail revenue, subsidiary gain



May 10--Dig below the gloomy first-quarter loss figures from TXU Corp. and you find a company that managed pretty well despite halting a giant build-out program and cutting prices.  The company faced a hostile environment during the quarter that it received a buyout bid that broke all records. TXU said "lower average retail pricing, customer attrition, an increase in the average cost of fuel and ...


May 10, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Chugach balks at wind farm



May 9--The change in leadership at the state's biggest electric company late last month has caused the utility to take a more critical look at a wind farm proposed for Anchorage's Fire Island.  The new majority on Chugach Electric Association's board campaigned on a cost-savings platform. It is raising questions about whether the wind farm makes financial sense.


May 9, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



PR executive foresees Inland area as major economic, social center



May 9--AARON KNOX  Title: President Company: TMG Communications Inc. Type of Industry: Public relations and public affairs Location: Riverside, with offices in Palm Desert and Victorville No. of employees: 12 Revenue: Undisclosed Year founded: 1989 Public relations head ushers in Inland growth  Over the past two decades, Inland Southern California has changed from a mostly rural afterthought into ...


May 9, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



TEP ordered to file proposals on calculating rate changes



May 9--State regulators have ordered Tucson Electric Power Co. to file a formal rate case to determine how its rates will be set after a freeze ends at the end of 2008.  The Arizona Corporation Commission prompted TEP to file three proposals by July 2. One will be market-based rates, which TEP favors. Another will be a "cost of service" regulation, with rates based on costs and an allowed maximum ...


May 9, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News





Cost of reopening U.S. nuclear reactor shows how difficult it will be to build new facilities



WASHINGTON: The Tennessee Valley Authority plans to reopen its Browns Ferry 1 nuclear reactor this month - 22 years after it was shut for safety reasons and five years after extensive renovations began. The move reflects the increased interest in nuclear power as an energy source that does not contribute to global warming. But the government agency's willingness to spend $1.8 billion on the ...


May 9, 2007 International Herald Tribune



Progress Moves Full Steam Ahead On Levy County Nuclear Plant Site



Progress Moves Full Steam Ahead On Levy County Nuclear Plant Site Skip directly to the full story. May 10, 2007 Tampa Tribune



Revised plan submitted for rejected wind farm



AUGUSTA - Developers of the Redington Wind Farm, whose plan for 30 turbines on two western Maine mountains was rejected by state regulators earlier this year, said they will submit plans for a scaled-back project as early as this week. In January, the Land Use Regulation Commission voted down a plan calling for 18 turbines on Black Nubble Mountain and 12 on Redington Pond Range.

Stop coal-fired power



As a resident of Sevier County, I would like to publicly thank the Utah Moms for Clean Air and the Utah Physicians for a Healthy Environment as they seek a moratorium on construction of new coal-fired power plants in Utah. A group of citizens in Sevier County called Sevier Citizens for Clean Air and Water, Inc. has been fighting for six years to stop the coal-fired power plant proposed by TDA ...

New task force takes up wind power



to review rules, incentives and siting guidelines for new wind power projects in Maine. The Governor's Task Force on Wind Power Development in Maine may recommend changes in the way projects are evaluated by the state. It also will explore technologies, identify benefits and incentives available to communities, help developers find the best locations for their projects and propose goals for wind ...


May 9, 2007 Portland Press Herald





Dominion's Free Video Helps Explain Customers' Natural Gas Supply Options



Understanding the choices that customers have when it comes to buying natural gas just got easier, thanks to a free video from Dominion East Ohio.     (Logo: http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20000831/DLOGO )     The six-minute video covers a number of topics, including the different selections available such as the Standard Service Offer (SSO), Energy Choice and aggregation.

Comverge Announces California Public Utility Commission's Approval of Its C&I Demand Response Program with Pacific Gas & Electric Company



EAST HANOVER, N.J., May 9 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Comverge, Inc. (Nasdaq: COMV) ('Comverge'), a leading provider of clean energy solutions through demand response, announced today that the California Public Utilities Commission has approved its Demand Response Purchase Agreement with Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E). Under the agreement, a Virtual Peaking Capacity (VPC) program will ...

Webcast Alert: Johnson Controls Energy Efficiency Indicator Webcast



Johnson Controls (NYSE: JCI) will release the results of the first-ever Energy Efficiency Indicator, a research report that examines how much North American businesses anticipate energy prices to increase and the actions they plan to take to combat those increases. Immediately following the research presentation, a panel of executives representing various organizations will describe their ...

WhiteFence Relaunch Improves Customer Experience



HOUSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--WhiteFence today announced the relaunch of WhiteFence.com, the popular online comparison shopping marketplace for residential utilities and home services. WhiteFence provides the largest online one-stop comparison marketplace for consumers looking to compare and order essential home services, including electricity, natural gas, home phone, high-speed Internet, cable and ...


May 9, 2007 Business Wire



Toromont Sells Halton Property



Toromont Industries Ltd. (TSX: TIH) announced today that it has completed the sale of a 60-acre parcel of land in the Region of Halton for proceeds of $18 million. As a result of the sale, Toromont will recognize a gain of $12.9 million after tax, or approximately $0.20 basic earnings per share, in the second quarter of 2007.  Toromont Industries Ltd. (TSX: TIH) announced today that it has ...

Wells Fargo Commits to Finance Fifth Wind Energy Project



Wells Fargo & Company ('Wells Fargo'), has committed to making an equity investment in the Fenton Wind Energy Project, Minnesota's largest wind farm, and Wells Fargo's fifth wind energy investment commitment in less than one year. Working with several other leading financial institutions, Wells Fargo will provide approximately $160 million in equity capital to the five projects, which will have ...

Calpine Energy Services agrees to $4.5 million civil penalty to resolve self-reported shipper-must-have-title violations

(CES), to allow a $4.5 million civil penalty claim in its bankruptcy proceeding to resolve ...


May 9, 2007 Federal Energy Regulatory Commission



Lehman to buy out Houston gas marketer Eagle Energy Partners



New York (Platts)--9May2007 New York investment bank Lehman Brothers said Wednesday it has agreed to buy out Houston natural gas and power marketer Eagle Energy Partners, founded in 2003 by former Dynegy CEO Chuck Watson. Lehman will acquire the two-thirds of Eagle it does not already own and combine Eagle's physical energy commodity marketing with Lehman's trading operation in financial energy ...

INTERNATIONAL NEWS







South Korea seeks cleaner energy sources



SEOUL: South Korea plans to break ground for the world's biggest solar power plant on Thursday as it tries to diversify its power sources and use cleaner energy. The $170 million plant, along with the world's largest tidal power plant that is already under construction off the country's west coast, is part of an aggressive effort to seek new and renewable energy sources at a time when global ...


May 9, 2007 International Herald Tribune



S. Korea to have world's top solar plant



Front Page> UPI Page advertisement SEOUL, May 9 (UPI) --  South Korea will have the world's largest solar power station in 2008 that will help the energy-poor country cope with high fuel costs. South Korea's Dongyang Engineering and Construction and Germany's SunTechnics will build a 20-megawatt solar plant in South Korea's southwest port town of Sinan by 2008, the companies said Wednesday. ...

Evelop and Ballast Nedam Acquire Exclusive Rights to Develop Offshore Wind Farm 'Scheveningen Buiten'



UTRECHT/NIEUWEGEIN, The Netherlands, May 9 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- On 26 April, Rijkswaterstaat Noordzee announced that the permit application, including the EIA (Environmental Impact Assessment ) submitted by Evelop International and Ballast Nedam Concessies (Concessions) for the offshore wind farm Scheveningen Buiten has been approved. No further applications for this location will be ...


May 9, 2007 PR Newswire



Power giant 'cashes in by keeping price cuts to itself'



Powergen was accused of giving customers a raw deal after it revealed that its profits have soared tenfold. Experts put the boom down to the energy firm's failure to pass on cheaper wholesale gas prices to its customers. E.ON, the German parent company of the firm - which has six million customers in Britain -announced that Powergen's profits soared to 296million in the first quarter of 2007. ...


May 10, 2007 Evening Standard



EDF Energies Nouvelles: First-Quarter 2007 Revenues: EUR 47.7 Million



PARIS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Regulatory News: EDF Energies Nouvelles (Paris:EEN) has reported near-stable consolidated revenues for the first quarter of the 2007 financial year. The key trends were as follows: a significant increase in Generation revenues to 44 million (up 23.9%), driven primarily by very strong growth in electricity generation using wind energy, an insignificant first quarter in ...


May 10, 2007 Business Wire



Wind financing grows despite risks



MILAN, Italy, May 9 (UPI) --  Outdated coal and nuclear plants across Europe will need to be replaced in coming years, and investors are picking renewables. 'The renewable industry is here to stay, the investment community would not get involved otherwise and I wouldn't have said that maybe three years ago,' said Nick Gardiner, director of the Energy & Utilities Group, Fortis, United Kingdom. ...
